message_1: What is the chemical equation for the decomposition reaction of potassium chlorate (KClO3) when heated and what are the products formed?
message_2:
When potassium chlorate (KClO3) is heated, it undergoes a decomposition reaction to form potassium chloride (KCl) and oxygen gas (O2). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 KClO3 (s) â†’ 2 KCl (s) + 3 O2 (g)

The products formed are potassium chloride (KCl) and oxygen gas (O2).
